sen.j: 松平 定綱（まつだいら さだつな、1592年3月8日（文禄元年1月25日 (旧暦)） - 1652年2月4日（慶安4年12月25日 (旧暦)））は江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA (March 8, 1592 – February 4, 1652) was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.
Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA (March 8, 1592 - February 4, 1652) was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.
Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA (March 8, 1592 - February 4, 1652) was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Edo period.

sen.j: 官名は従四位下、越中守。
sen.e: The official title was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province).
The official title was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Etchu no kami (Governor of Etchu Province).
The official title was Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Etchu no kami (Governor of Etchu Province).

sen.j: 下総国山川藩、常陸国下妻藩、遠江国掛川藩、山城国淀藩、美濃国大垣藩の各藩主および伊勢国桑名藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the lord of Yamakawa Domain in Shimousa Province, Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province, Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province, Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province, Ogaki Domain in Mino Province and the first lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.

He was the lord of Yamakawa Domain in Shimosa Province, Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province, Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province, Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province, and Ogaki Domain in Mino Province and the first lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.

He was the lord of Yamakawa Domain in Shimosa Province, Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province, Kakegawa Domain in Totomi Province, Yodo Domain in Yamashiro Province, and Ogaki Domain in Mino Province and the first lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.

sen.j: 定綱系久松松平家初代。
sen.e: The first generation of Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.
The first generation of Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.
The first generation of Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.

sen.j: 伊予松山藩祖・松平定勝の三男。
sen.e: The third son of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, the founder of the Matsuyama domain in Iyo.
The third son of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, the founder of the Matsuyama domain in Iyo.
The third son of Sadakatsu MATSUDAIRA, the founder of the Matsuyama domain in Iyo.

sen.j: 母は奥平貞友の娘（たつ、二之丸殿）。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter (Tatsu, Ninomaru dono) of Sadatomo OKUDAIRA.
His mother was a daughter (Tatsu or Ninomaru dono) of Sadatomo OKUDAIRA.
His mother was a daughter (Tatsu or Ninomaru dono) of Sadatomo OKUDAIRA.

sen.j: 徳川家康は伯父に当たる。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was his uncle.
Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was his uncle.
Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was his uncle.

sen.j: 家康の母・於大の方は祖母。
sen.e: Odai no kata, the mother of Ieyasu was his grandmother.
Odai no kata, the mother of Ieyasu was his grandmother.
Odai no kata, the mother of Ieyasu was his grandmother.

sen.j: 正室は浅野長政の娘で、寛永10年（1633年）卒去。
sen.e: His lawful wife, who was a daughter of Nagamasa ASANO, died in 1633.
His lawful wife, who was a daughter of Nagamasa ASANO, died in 1633.
His lawful wife, who was a daughter of Nagamasa ASANO, died in 1633.

sen.j: 智相院殿光誉馨安樹清大姉を贈られ、霊巌寺に葬られる。
sen.e: She was given a posthumous Buddhist name 智相院殿光誉馨安樹清大姉 and buried in Reigan-ji Temple.
She was given a posthumous Buddhist name 智相院殿光誉馨安樹清大姉 and buried in Reigan-ji Temple.
She was given a posthumous Buddhist name 智相院殿光誉馨安樹清大姉 and buried in Reigan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 子は松平定次（長男）、松平定良（次男）、娘（酒井忠清正室）、娘（松平定経正室）、娘（酒井忠正正室）など。
sen.e: His children were Sadatsugu MATSUDAIRA (the first son), Sadayoshi MATSUDAIRA (the second son), a daughter (the lawful wife of Tadakiyo SAKAI), a daughter (the lawful wife of Sadatsune MATSUDAIRA), a daughter (the lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKAI) and others.

His children included Sadatsugu MATSUDAIRA (the oldest son), Sadayoshi MATSUDAIRA (the second son), and three daughters (the lawful wife of Tadakiyo SAKAI, the lawful wife of Sadatsune MATSUDAIRA, and the lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKAI).

His children included Sadatsugu MATSUDAIRA (the oldest son), Sadayoshi MATSUDAIRA (the second son), and three daughters (the lawful wife of Tadakiyo SAKAI, the lawful wife of Sadatsune MATSUDAIRA, and the lawful wife of Tadamasa SAKAI).

sen.j: 慶長元年（1596年）、荒川次郎九郎の養子となるが、同4年（1599年）家康の命により荒川氏相続を停止、松平氏に復する。
sen.e: In 1596, he was adopted by Jiro Kuro ARAKAWA, but in 1599 he was ordered not to inherit the Arakawa clan by Ieyasu and returned to the Matsudaira clan.
1596: Adopted by Jiro Kuro ARAKAWA, but in 1599 he was ordered by Ieyasu not to inherit the Arakawa clan and returned to the Matsudaira clan.
1596: Adopted by Jiro Kuro ARAKAWA, but in 1599 he was ordered by Ieyasu not to inherit the Arakawa clan and returned to the Matsudaira clan.

sen.j: 同7年（1602年）、初めて家康に拝謁、2代将軍・徳川秀忠に仕えるよう命ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1602, he had an audience with Ieyasu for the first time and was ordered to serve the second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA by Ieyasu.
1602: Had an audience with Ieyasu for the first time and was ordered to serve the second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA by Ieyasu.
1602: Had an audience with Ieyasu for the first time and was ordered to serve the second Shogun Hidetada TOKUGAWA by Ieyasu.

sen.j: 同9年（1604年）、下総国山川領の内5千石を賜う。
sen.e: In 1604, he was given 5,000 koku in a part of Yamakawa in Shimousa Province.
1604: Given 5,000 koku in a part of Yamakawa territory in Shimosa Province.
sen.cmt: 年表表示にし、補足しました。
sen.e: 1604: Given 5,000 koku in a part of Yamakawa territory in Shimosa Province.

sen.j: 同12年（1607年）、従五位下越中守に叙任。
sen.e: In 1607, he was appointed Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Ecchu no kami (Governor of Ecchu Province).
1607: Appointed Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Etchu no kami.
sen.cmt: 年表表示にし、前出補足を削除しました。
sen.e: 1607: Appointed Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Etchu no kami.

sen.j: 同14年（1609年）、下総山川藩1万5千石を賜い、大名となる。
sen.e: In 1609, he was given 15,000 koku in the Shimousa-Yamakawa Domain and became the lord.
1609: Given 15,000 koku in the Shimosa-Yamakawa Domain and became a daimyo.
sen.cmt: 年表表示にし、用語を変えました。
sen.e: 1609: Given 15,000 koku in the Shimosa-Yamakawa Domain and became a daimyo.

sen.j: 大坂の役では書院番頭として出陣、その功により元和 (日本)2年（1616年）、常陸国下妻藩2万石に移る。
sen.e: At the Siege of Osaka, he departed for the front as the chief of military patrol and in 1616 he was transferred to the Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province holding 20,000 koku for his achievements.
At the Siege of Osaka, he departed for the front as the chief of military patrol and in 1616 he was transferred to the Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province holding 20,000 koku for his achievements.
At the Siege of Osaka, he departed for the front as the chief of military patrol and in 1616 he was transferred to the Shimotsuma Domain in Hitachi Province holding 20,000 koku for his achievements.

sen.j: 同4年（1618年）、掛川城3万石に転じ、さらに同9年（1623年）には山城国淀城を修繕し城を守るよう命ぜられ3万5千石を賜う。
sen.e: In 1618 he was transferred to Kakegawa-jo Castle holding 30,000 koku and in 1623 he was ordered to repair and keep Yodo-jo Castle in Yamashiro Province holding 35,000 koku.
1618: Transferred to Kakegawa-jo Castle holding 30,000 koku and in 1623 he was ordered to repair and keep Yodo-jo Castle in Yamashiro Province holding 35,000 koku.
1618: Transferred to Kakegawa-jo Castle holding 30,000 koku and in 1623 he was ordered to repair and keep Yodo-jo Castle in Yamashiro Province holding 35,000 koku.

sen.j: 寛永10年（1633年）、美濃国大垣城6万石へ転じる。
sen.e: In 1633, he was transferred to Ogaki-jo Castle in Mino Province holding 60,000 koku.
1633: Transferred to Ogaki-jo Castle in Mino Province holding 60,000 koku.
1633: Transferred to Ogaki-jo Castle in Mino Province holding 60,000 koku.

sen.j: 翌年、従四位下に昇進。
sen.e: The next year he was listed in the Daimyo (feudal lord) families which were promoted to higher than Shihon (the fourth rank).
The next year he was promoted Jushiinoge.
sen.cmt: 原文には 「四品以上に昇進する大名家一覧」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「従四位下」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: The next year he was promoted Jushiinoge.

sen.j: さらに同12年（1635年）、5万石の加増を受けて、伊勢国桑名城に入る。
sen.e: In 1635, he was given additional 50,000 koku and entered in Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Privince.
1635: Given additional 50,000 koku and entered in Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Province.
1635: Given additional 50,000 koku and entered in Kuwana-jo Castle in Ise Province.

sen.j: 慶安4年（1651年）、江戸で卒去。
sen.e: In 1651 he died in Edo.
1651: Died in Edo.
1651: Died in Edo.

sen.j: 享年60。
sen.e: He died at 60.
Died at the age of 60.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Died at the age of 60.

sen.j: 大鏡院殿前四品玄蓮社定誉一法大居士と贈られ、江戸深川 (江東区)霊巌寺 (東京都江東区)で火葬され、遺骨は桑名照源寺へ贈られ埋葬される。
sen.e: He was given the posthumous Buddhist name 大鏡院殿前四品玄蓮社定誉一法大居士 and cremated in Reigan-ji Temple in Edo Fukagawa (Koto Ward, Tokyo) and buried in Kuwana Shogen-ji Temple.
He was given the posthumous Buddhist name 大鏡院殿前四品玄蓮社定誉一法大居士 and cremated in Reigan-ji Temple in Edo Fukagawa (Koto Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) and buried in Kuwana Shogen-ji Temple.
He was given the posthumous Buddhist name 大鏡院殿前四品玄蓮社定誉一法大居士 and cremated in Reigan-ji Temple in Edo Fukagawa (Koto Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) and buried in Kuwana Shogen-ji Temple.

sen.j: 寛政9年（1797年）、神号・鎮国大明神と追祠される。
sen.e: In 1797, he was given a title of god, Chinkoku Daimyojin to be enshrined further.
1797: Given a title of god, Chinkoku Daimyojin to be enshrined further.
1797: Given a title of god, Chinkoku Daimyojin to be enshrined further.
